greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Product_{k>=0} (1 + 1/2^k).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
formula: lim sup Product_{k=0..floor(log_2(n))} (1 + 1/floor(n/2^k)) for n-->oo. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 20 2007
lim sup A132369(n)/A098844(n) for n-->oo. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 20 2007
lim sup A132269(n)/n^((1+log_2(n))/2) for n-->oo. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 20 2007
lim sup A132270(n)/n^((log_2(n)-1)/2) for n-->oo. - _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 20 2007
Equals 2*(-1/2; 1/2)_{infinity}, where (a;q)_{infinity} is the q-Pochhammer symbol. - _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 20 2015
mathematica: digits = 105; NProduct[1 + 1/2^k, {k, 0, Infinity}, WorkingPrecision -> digits+5, NProductFactors -> digits] // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 04 2013 *)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 09 2003
